column4: my ISP gave me 2 ips. how would i be able to use the other ip instead of dhcping to this one (there both static) any ideas?
set your ip address to the other ip
WOW thats was good help man WHY DO YOU THIN K I CAME IN HERE!!! i dont know how
if someone tells you your question is unclear, why not try to clarify?
stop it.  i understand now.  there's no reason to be a dick about it.
are you running gnome?
fuck now i hate it :P
forget it.  find someone else.
what you think is a perfectly worded quesition may not be to someone else
instead of telling me my question doesnt make sence to you tell me what parts :)
so, if you like, tell me if you're running gnome or not in response to my previous question
is your interface eth0?
look for the interface with an ip address
oops i thought you said ipconfig
did you not install gnome and any of the other tools, or are you just running xfce4 aside from it?
no gnome is installed
try typing 'sudo network-admin'
sorry, i misread that as gnome being installed
so configureing this wonk work then? should i exit network-admin?
no
if it came up, it'll work
as in no, don't exit
did your isp give you a gateway address?
